Job Title: Tax Specialist

Location: Brea, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Position Overview:We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Tax Specialist to join our team. As a Tax Specialist, you will be responsible for analyzing financial data, preparing tax returns, and ensuring compliance with tax regulations. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in financial concepts and sales, as well as experience in public accounting and financial services.
Primary Job Responsibilities:Coordinate, supervise, and review federal, state, and international taxes prepared by outside tax advisors.Provide supporting documents to tax consultants, including monthly/quarterly sales tax support and quarterly/annual income tax support.Review deliverables from tax consultants to uphold a timely tax calendar, covering income tax estimates, extensions, and tax returns.Prepare and file US state sales taxes and Canadian GST taxes.Prepare precise calculations for personal property tax files, business licenses, and other local tax filings.Update tax codes in the ERP system to ensure accurate and up-to-date tax information.Assist with the development and implementation of tax-saving strategies for the consolidated group.Maintain a comprehensive tax calendar for income taxes, sales tax, property tax, and various business license filings.Conduct assessments of US sales tax nexus and propose new registrations when thresholds are met.Provide proactive updates on any changes in tax laws or regulations that may impact the organization.Respond to audit requests from various taxing authorities as required.Provide support on other ad hoc tasks as requested.
Required Education and Related Job Experience:Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or related fieldCPA certification preferredMinimum of 5 years of experience in tax preparation or related fieldStrong knowledge of financial concepts and accounting principlesExperience with accounting software and spreadsheetsFamiliarity with regulatory reporting requirementsExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsExceptional attention to detail and accuracy in data analysisStrong communication skills, both written and verbal
About our Company: Evriholder Product LLC is an innovative company that specializes in a wide variety of household categories including Kitchen, Produce, Bath & Beauty, Cleaning, and more! Established in 1995, our company is dedicated to bringing unique products with superior functionality to consumers at an outstanding value.
As an industry leader our company is world renowned. Our employees are the best of the best! We seek to hire smart, highly qualified, and motivated people to join our company. Individuals who dare to make a difference; that will challenge the status quo will always thrive at Evriholder Products.
Our workplace experience is fun, challenging, rewarding and team-collaborative all at the same time. We fully support employees who want to BE GREAT by providing them with the opportunity to do so. If you believe what we have just described is exactly what you’re searching for in your next role, and you meet the position requirements, we strongly encourage you to apply for the position with Evriholder Products now! 
Evriholder Products LLC is a Fair and Equal Opportunity Employer. We will consider all applicants for employment that are qualified in a manner consistent with federal, state, and local laws.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
